intro: Coffea floresiana, commonly known as the Flores coffee. It is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family, native to the island of Flores in Indonesia. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by red berries containing the seeds used for coffee. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1-2 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
